posts.post_content:
So, I picked up some Innistrad and M12 packs the other day. In the last M12 pack I opened I finally got a Chandra, and in my first Innistrad pack I pulled this. I feel like this is the universe telling me to put together some kind of RB control/burn deck. Maybe discard [Chandra's Phoenix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra's Phoenix) with Liliana's +1 and bring it back into my hand with Chandra's? I'll have to look for other, more game ending combos.  
  
Okay, fine, I actually just want to see if having them both in play at the same time gives me the kind of nerd erection that I think it will. DON'T JUDGE ME!
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
@Lord of Shadow - It's similar to legend rule except the subtype is all that matters. People played Jace Beleren in order to kill Jace, the Mind Sculptor. So 1![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) Jace Beleren basically could be "Destroy Jace, the Mind Sculptor" or keep opposing players from playing their Jaces.
  
   
So basically Liliana Vess and Liliana of the Veil would kill each other since they can't exist at the same time.
posts.html:
@Lord of Shadow - It's similar to legend rule except the subtype is all that matters. People played Jace Beleren in order to kill Jace, the Mind Sculptor. So 1 Jace Beleren basically could be "Destroy Jace, the Mind Sculptor" or keep opposing players from playing their Jaces.

So basically Liliana Vess and Liliana of the Veil would kill each other since they can't exist at the same time.

posts.post_content:
Behold the new queen of Magic, and not just Standard, mind you. The new Liliana is appearing on everything, from the title screen for Duels of the Planeswalkers 2012 (in which she has a killer deck) to the boxes included with Innistrad Fat Packs and even on the front page for magicthegathering.com. Liliana Vess has literally taken over all things Magic. Truly, the new dominant force in the Multiverse, at least until Bolas decides to gett off his ancient ass.
  
   
@stay70573 Yes.

posts.post_content: I have made a deck that already takes advantage of her. I can kick of her ultimate mulitple times in game just for the fact BW Decks are really good at control. Mirran Cruaders and Phyrexian crusaders with her are really mean which is another feature to combo with her but I really like the fact that I have my play set of her. But I still have to admit she is really expensive at the moment for most people to use so she will either pull a gideon or a Jace 2.0 and start out expensive and go down or just stay expensive.

posts.post_content: I honestly can't fathom her price tag, but I'm not the type to pay 40 for one magic card. Her first two abiliities are all you really need her for. Her ultimate's good, but not good enough to worth chucking 3 cards and not making your opponent sac anything. But alternating between the first two abilities with some proliferate or whatever can lock an opponent down while they're trying to stabilize, and you can use that advantage to get ahead and beat them down.
posts.html:

But alternating between the first two abilities with some proliferate or whatever can lock an opponent down while they're trying to stabilize, and you can use that advantage to get ahead and beat them down.

posts.post_content: Question Can Liliana Vess be played with Liliana of the Viel. They are technically not the same Planeswalker (yes same person but not same card). I have heard a similar question before with can you play both Jace Beleren and Jace the Mindsculptor at the same time as they aren't the same Jace card. With that other question no one managed to actually answer it. I haven't managed to find rules against this yet.
